comments.text: Probably the best spot to go to Kaunas, got picked up in like 3 minutes (maybe got lucky). There are a lot of cars but already they are going pretty fast. It easy to get from bus top "Gariūnai".

10 minutes from the bus stop Kauno plentas. I arrived around 11h30 on a Monday, and with a signe to Klaipeda. Somone took me to Kaunas. Nice spot, but no shadow, cars go kinda fast already. Still, you get all the Trafic from Vilnius to Kaunas.
Note : there is an underpass just before the spot, might be worth trying to reach it from the other side. Crossing the out and on lane before arriving to the spot might be sketchy when there are a lot of people. It would be a pretty long

The free bus to maxima isn't running anymore, I just took a regular bus to "Gariunai" station for 0,90€ and walked the rest of the way (which is a great option, there is a footpath next to the highway and you don't have to cross it, so it's really safe this way!). When I reached it I got a lift to Kaunas after just 5 minutes, so this is a really good spot, even though the cars are driving quite fast and there are already multiple lanes. But the cars can easily see you, and there is enough space
Best spot to leave Vilnius to Kaunas
Very good spot, It is no usual but car in lituania stop on highway,
less than 20 seconds. best spot for kaunas and klaipeda
Cars go fast but there is plenty of space for them to notice you and then stop on the bus stop which is easily accessible by public transport.
Great spot if you wanna go to Kaunas. There’s a bus stop where cars can stop.
Really quickly got a ride to Alytus
Got a ride to Merkinė with a sign saying Druskininkai. Definitely better to stand next to the gas station, lots of runoff for cars to stop.

Towards Alytus direction, the gas station is barely used, but at nighttime gotta stay closer to it, lights arent the best but it's good spot nevertheless, safe for cars to pull over, wait time of 10-15 minutes
Perfect place, just check the ferry arrival times, lots of trucks to Latvia and Estonia.

Note that the ferries arrive only 2 times a day (9:00 and 15:00 as of July 2013)
No point in hitching here before 9, and from then about 100 trucks are coming continuously for at least 3 hours, maybe more.

Note that most trucks are Lithuanian, I was waiting here with a LV/EST sign for 2 hours. Then I changed the sign to Siauliai/Panevezys and got picked in 10 minutes. Learn from my mistake :)
Great spot to find trucks going to the biggest cities in Baltic countries. Got picked up by a truck driver to Riga just after a ferry from Kiel arrived.
We were on gas station for 30 mins but nobody took us. We walked 100 meters in front of the gas station and caught car in 3 mins.
Good spot where cars go slowly and can see you and has plenty of space to park a car.
Good spot to catch car to Riga. We went with Lithuanians going for a trip to Riga. We got to this Gas station by Bolt from Panevezy.
i stood at the exit from the gas station before the roundabout. literally the first car that passed by took me to Vilnius.
We did not hitchike from the gas station but walked closer to the roundabout as there is still plenty of space for cars to stop and a truck driver took us to outskirts to Vilnius.
Very easy to get rides to Vilnius. Kaunas not so much.
We had 1 hour before the bus scheduled bus, so we randomly tried our luck and literally in 1 minute a local lady took us back to Vilnius.
Awesome place to go to Vilnius! Lots of cars.
Asked cars on the ferry ( that costs 1,50€), it was really quick to get a car to go to Nida
I was standing before the ferry entrance with the picture  "Nida". I got a car in 10 min.

Depending where you want to go you can have a lift to Juodkrante, Nida or even Kalliningrad. And that's very easy. You ask the car drivers on the ferry. Third driver you'll ask definatelly will take you.

I guess making a sign to a town close to the border would work better but I got a ride decently fast with my Sejny sign. Also the bus stop has space to pull over, works better than the gas station unless you’re asking people directly
My go to spot if I'm headed towards south, always got a car within 5 minutes, great bus stop and cars are rather slow
Cars go slow and have space to pull over, good towards Liepaja. Not a crazy amount of traffic but largely enough
Good spot just at the border (with a cafe in case), not a lot of traffic but "sorted"

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, rain. Going to Riga.
Very good space. After the junction with traffic lights, so people have time to see you when waiting at the red light.
There is an extra line to turn right. Almost never used coz it's leading to one business building. It's long enough even for two lorries to stop.
I got a ride after a few minutes.

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, rain.
Very good space. After the junction with traffic lights, so people have time to see you when waiting at the red light.
There is an extra line to turn right. Almost never used coz it's leading to one business building. It's long enough even for two lorries to stop.
I got a ride after a few minutes.
bus stopped and gave us a ride (could have gone to Vilnius too)
Towards Germaniškis/LV, decent amount of traffic, city limits so slow speeds, wide shoulder of the road, wait times of 5-15 minutes

Towards Biržai, ideal spot, loads of low speed cars all going to there the least, wait times of 5-10 minutes, you could even go Biržai-Germaniškis/Skaistkalne-Riga if you want to go around the via baltica
Cars are going fast but there’s lots of space for them to stop and they can see you well
Towards Zarasai, very good spot as after the roundabout there's huge shoulder, possible to stop a lorry, very low traffic though, so be prepared to wait a bit, wait times of 5-35 minutes expected
Towards Utena, quite a good spot, decent visibility, a bit annoying guardrails but you'll get a car within 20 or so minutes to go further

The roundabout seemed very awkward for me, so I walked to this bus stop, direction Ukmerge, got a car within a minute, I'd honestly rather be here than on the roundabout, nowadays there are very awkwardly placed guardrails all over the place and no real room for cars to stop
Towards Jonava, very low traffic, but first or second car will most likely stop, decent road, due to low traffic you can stop car anywhere, wait times of 5-30 minutes expected

Towards Vandžiogala, low traffic but high likelyhood to stop a car, anywhere around here will work, you can  take the bus nr 23 to Domeikava and walk here, wide shoulders, wait time of 10-20 minutes expected

Disagree with other review. Quite a lot of traffic in the gas station, people stopping to eat, and also going out from the stores behind. Possible to ask around and also just stand at the exit with a sign. Had sign PL, got a ride to my destination Suwałki.
1st car that passed tooked me all the way to the ferry
Bus stop. Sunny monday morning, couple ~25yo, no sign. Catched a ride to Panavezys fast. You can reach the spot stop easy with public transport.

Very good spot for going further north, lots of cars, decent visibility, here the road goes from 2+2 to 1+1, enough room to stop a car comfortably, try to find a car going the least to LV, lots of locals, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
Towards Palanga, amazing spot, loads of traffic, decent visibility, quite  some of the cars drive pretty fast but cars coming from Klaipeda are still pretty slow, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected
Great spot towards Taurage or Šilute, slow speeds, good visibility
Towards Jurbarkas/Taurage, amazing spot, cars go slow from the highway or from the Kryškalnis roundabout, just right amount of traffic, wait times of 5-10 minutes expected
Perfect spot for going towards Kelme, Kryžkalnis, loads of traffic that hasn't sped up yet, usually a car would stop within 5-10 minutes
Towards Kuršenai, Šiauliai, small bus stop, but there's speed bump just after it so cars go all very slow, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected, decent amount of long distance drivers
Great spot towards Latvia, got taken to the border, easy to continue from there.
Bus stop where drivers can safely pull over, towards Klaipeda
Good spot to get onwards to Silute and Klaipeda
same as the other ferry exit, pretty easy, just ask on the ferry or stand after it

Feels weird to hh long distance in the middle of the city and some drivers made annoyed gestures, but I got the ride and this should be the best space to go eastward with how the roads work here. Sign with kaunas (even though I wanted to go to Poland) would probably be very helpful here.

It's a bus stop, car are not going too fast, for most of them
For me the best spot to go to palanga
Quite far from the center if you walk all the way, but there is a walking path to cross the highway
Not so many cars were here, but once I started hitchhiking with the sign "Rīga", I got a ride in 3 or 4 minutes that took me to the place I wanted
Great spot for going north, went directly to riga.
Incredibly wide bus stops either direction, (like seriously, you can easily stop lorries to them as well), good visibility, cars do drive fast but wait times of 10-25 minutes are expected.

Towards Prienai, Kaunas, during daytime use this area where cars turn out from the petrol station, low speeds either way, good visibility and convenient for cars to stop, during nighttime, you have to stay around the entrance of the petrol station as about there the street lights end, wait time of 5-30 minutes to be expected
One of my go-to spots to get out of Kaunas, just stand just before the slowing down lane, good visibility for cars, wait time of 5-20 minutes usually
A small bus stop towards Telšiai, speeds are up here, but by now most locals have turned away with the exception of Balenos residents, good visibility, wait time of 5-30 minutes expected
Towards Mažeikiai, decent traffic, slow speeds after the border crossing, wide enough road where the toll exits, wait time of 5-20 minutes to be expected
Got quite lucky as the first person who stopped was heading straight to Warsaw. He was very lovely Latvian man and he even offered me both breakfast and lunch on our way to Poland.

One male 40+, no sign, one small and one big bagpacks, rain.
I was hitching on the smaller, parallel road. There was very little traffic. On a map I noticed a bus stop on the highway (strange thing, but it looks Lithuanians do it). Plenty of space to stop and good visibility. Nice spot.
After 45 minutes, I got a ride to Posvalys. Good ride on my way to Riga.
Maybe got lucky because as soon as I switched places I got a ride to Kaunas from here. Yeah but the spot ain't that but maybe longer waiting time is possible.
Wide road towards PL, not a lot of traffic, but high odds of getting a car going long distance, wait time of 10 minutes

Not the most of traffic, but good to catch cars coming from Leipalingis direction, but it's very wide so you can also have cars from Seirijai stopping here, in all honesty great spot yet again on this road, wait time of 10 minutes
There was a speed bump and low speeds, also a bit of a space for cars to stop, got a ride within 10 minutes, also have seen hitchhikers here before so I presume it's quite a used spot
Good wide bus stop after roundabout, lots of locals have turned other directions so good odds of getting at least to Seirijai, wait time of 5 minutes
Great spot towards west, wide straight road, with nice bus stop, beware that road goes soon to two so ask the driver which direction are they going to take, got a car within 5 minutes
Speeds are a bit slow and from now onwards, most traffic goes longer distances, wide bus stop with good visibility, wait time of 5 minutes
Since you are out of Lentvaris, it's easier to get ride to Trakai, not too much traffic, but first car picked me up, with wait time of 1 minute
Nice wide bus stop, direction west, once in position got a ride within first minute, be aware that the road splits ahead so make sure you know which direction the driver is gonna take

Very good spot for the Šiauliai direction, decent traffic, wait time of couple minutes and during the winter, there's also Kryžkalnis bus stop just down this road, so if you would get stuck you can go there

Very good spot for north direction, cars coming from turn are actually on mainway, but its sharp so everyone drives very slow, it's 50km/h area, but most were at 20km/h 30km/h, side of the road is wide and easily stoppable for a car, wait time of 5 minutes
Just walked on the road, third or so car stopped, direction Panemunis, lots of locals, did see one LV car coming from north but thats it, not that used road, wait time of 10-15 minutes
Nice straight road, more cars are starting to head towards Pandelys from villages around, still lots of local traffic, but got ride within 5 minutes
Towards Papilys, good straight part of the road, not much of a shoulder, but there isn't that much traffic here, wait time of 5 minutes
Towards Papilys, not the most used road and lots of local traffic, but speeds are here still relatively slow, wait time of 10 minutes

Always a good spot for heading towards Biržai, trafficwise not the most popular road, but there's speed bump just before and very wide bus stop, plus a cool statue to look at when there's no cars, waiting times of 5-15 minutes
Ask the driver on the gas station. Find straight to go to panevekys
There are some bus to go there. I asked cars in the gas station. Find a ride to Ukmerge on the way to riga.
Shit spot

Best gas station from Klaipeda in direction of Kaunas/Vilnius 
2024
Nice spot towards Riga. We got picked up after 15 minutes on a holiday with really low traffic.
Perfect spot. Cars go slow, plenty of space to stop even for trucks. Mostly trucks go here, so ideal for one person.
literally the first car passing me agreed to take me to Ukmerge.
best spot to Vilnius, plenty of cars going in the same direction, good visibility

I got a car really by the exit from the gas station. Before me I saw two other hitchhikers trying to catch a car by the highway with no success. Better to use the gas station exit imo as you get less cars but they go slower.
Best spot in direction to Latvia, Riga as there is a bus stop so cars have space to stop.
Ask a truck driver to drop me at the petrol station just after this spot. Walked back to that spot and got a ride straight to the museum of kgb (the lady was nice enough to drive me there)

Eventhough it was a quiet, dark, winter evening on a weekday and there wasn't much traffic around, a nice middle aged woman took me straight to Jelgava station, where I could catch a train to Rīga. It's well lit when it gets dark. I was a young single foreigner.

Eventhough it was a quiet winter evening (19:30) on a workday and there wasn't much traffic around, I could get to Jelgava from this spot in a single run, as a foreigner. It's well lit when it gets dark.
>JoniÅ¡kis,Riga,Tallinn,...
Great spot, got a ride all the way to Warsaw from the second car I asked. Quite annoying to get to though.

There was not a lot of traffic when I got there on a Sunday morning, but when you go to the petrol station right behind it is a parking space for trucks. I just held out my PL sign to their windows and got a ride to Poland immediately
A bit far to walk from the  minibus stop in Garliava, but easy to get a ride from trucks.
It seemed me very good, but now is part of this road in rekonstruction so car in direction to PL have to digress to left stripe, so the wide and long stripe is unused

I don't think this is a very good spot if you are two. Cars are moving too fast to see you and pull over, and not much traffic in station other than trucks. We don't normally get picked up by trucks as a duo :( Ended up going to PL via Alytus: more short hops, but less waiting on the side of the road!

Stood at the end of the gas station to catch the road + people leaving the station and quickly found a ride a bit forwards. Probably better to get a ride to Latvia from here though, than to get shorter ones.
Good spot to get a direct ride to Riga, a lot of Latvians stop here. After asking around for 45 minutes it worked for me.
Nice spot overall, not too much traffic, not too little traffic. Asking around is really simple there.
Don't take rides that go just a little further. Be careful and wait for a ride straight to Riga
Tried hitchhiking to riga with no results. Decided to switch closer to town. Came back here and got a ride to Riga in 2 minutes
a polish guy stopped soon and took me to Suwalki.
Super good spot. I would recommend this one over the one on the gas station if you are more than 1 person. We got taken almost immediately.
Perfect spot in direction to Poland, but most of them are trucks so it's more difficult to get a ride with more than 1 person.
petrol station is not the best place but directly at the street is working just write PL if you want to go to poland and it need 15-20min

Reach this place with the number 105 minibus which goes from in front of the Main train station it costs 2L 
And stand here because this is where the ring joins the E67 so they're slightly slowing down and it's better than the petrol station since You'll have the whole highway going next to You :D

Not so many cars at the truck stop, had pretty quick luck with a PL sign. So this spot works and I do believe all the people saying its the best available in Kaunas, but I still dont like the 20min walk along the highway and how fast the cars are going here.
All the way to the southern border
got a ride to Warsaw in 5 mins
Just before the gas station, not the best spot speed or space wise but got a ride to Warsaw very quickly. Probably got lucky. Also have to walk a kilometer or two to reach here.

Very bad place, There is no bus stop anymore because of a new connection line to high way from Kaunas, so There are 3 lines and cars go pretty Fast. We moved 150 meteres away from this place in direct from Kaunas. There are barriers and a side line, which is free and good to stop for cars. We Made it with a guy right to Vilnius and He even took us around Trakai. But it was a big luck.

Indeed the perfect spot! Hitchhiked here around 3:30 pm on a Friday, got a ride to Vilnius under 10 mins.
Car coming up isn’t at high speed so it’s relatively easy for them to pull by
Nice spot, got a lift pretty fast, had to wait only like 10 minutes
Very good spot, plenty of traffic, and many driver stopping and asking where you want to go.
This is where drivers expect to see the hitch-hikers that are going to Vilnius, one of the most popular places in Lithuania. No better option than this one for Vilnius or Minsk.
Nice spot. Got a ride to Panevezys very very fast.
Not to much traffic but there is a bus bay which is so big that even a truck can stop. Got ride to the outskirts of Riga
I initially stood at the exit but as it was getting late I decided to ask drivers instead. The second guy I asked took me to Vilnius

got very lucky and picked up by the first car approached.
helped to change oil and the ride was ready to go.
was waiting for a lot of time but luckily got a guy who was going straight to my destination

I was waiting at this place with the sign: Suwalki, there is a good place for stopping because there is a stop for trucks with carwash, restaurant, gas station. It was in the morning Sunday and there was not so much cars but after 20 min, one driver saw me and my sign and he stopped, I said that I go to Poland, he said that he go to Warsaw and I said that I need only to the ELK city and we went well.

Tried here for 15min towards Kaunas in the evening. Didn't get a ride, though I would've gotten one to Vilnius after 10 min. Asking truck drivers and other people at the gas station hadn't worked for half an hour before changing to this spot.
Very high traffic, driver asks by himself without us trying to hitchhike in direction to Kaunas.

Restaurant and 2 gas stations, but the traffic was very low on monday morning. Decided to hitchhike by the road just before the station. Cars ignored us, finally someone came and offered us a ride to Riga. I guess we were unlucky, spot looked decent.
Ask driver on the gas station. Not so many cars. Find a ride to Pasvalys (I was asking to go there) on the way to riga.

If your driver goes to the city, if it's possible, ask him to drop you off here, big gas station and restaurant, you are visiable and there is a spot to pick you up. The only porblem is, al lot of people with are not going to give you a ride, will stop here. So my advice, make some hand signals to make sure, they stop here for you
Got taken to pagegiai almost instantly, and from there it's easy to hitchhike further on
Good chances to hitch a lift to Silute mostly. It won't take you long here.
ferry w good traffic
Towards Nida.
Brilliant spot, got a ride to taurage immediately.
Good spot direction of Taurage. I used to hitchhike from here lots of times. I takes about 15-45 min.
Very good spot for going towards west, cars go slow on this bendy part and long good driveway to stop, not the best lighting for dark times, but always got a ride within 10 minutes
Good to reach Alytus
Road to hh to Druskininkai, Marijampolė or Alytus. There is a bus stop and because of uphill round cars don't go very fast.
Great spot towards Moletai, lots of cars go actually to Vilnius, at night it has lights which is another bonus however no the most traffic by then anymore, wait time of 5-10 minutes
All the cars passing here are going to Vilnius or Moletai. Nevertheless, I had to wait 25 min to get a lift. It rained and my desesperate look made a car stop!
Pretty good place for hh direction of Moletai, Vilnius. It doesn't take long to get a lift.
Lots of roadwork in end 2024. It will soon change everything with a big highway without any stop I think. There are a lot of gas station around in the Lituanian part
Everyone going to anywhere in Baltics goes through here at a slow speed. A good place to get off if you need Riga or Tallin, but your driver is going to Vilnius.

Nice spot, bus stop + gas station, you can get there with the bus 45 and then by walking for a while. Plenty of space for the cars to stop. Got a ride to Trakai (but with Vilnius sign)in around 10 mins
If you start your hitchhiking here, it wont took a long time to get a car.
Spot is really great, there's planty place to stop and there's gas station near where you can ask drivers. We've got ride directly to Latvian border
a bus stop after Toyota car shop. You can get here by micro busses (little white vans).
1st car drove me to Lublin (Pl, 7 hours ride). Probably was super lucky. But cars drive slowly and safe space to pull over.
Got a ride by truck to Poland for 600km in 30min :)

This cross road is very good if you want to go to Poland or further via Poland. There are two ways:
TIP: Route 131 is better, than 132, because is prohibited for big trucks to use route 132.
Way nr. 1 (it splits later into few options)
1. All big trucks is going via route 131,  later joining A5 after Kalvarija, crossing the boarder Lithuania-Poland, at Budzisko, near Suwalki. At this place there is route nr. 8, which goes to Piotrkow Trybunalski via Augustow, Bialystok, Zambrow, Warszawa. From P
We got very lucky and literally the first car picked us up! But even though traffic is slow, cars don’t have much space to stop.

Towards north, uncomfortable for cars to stop, poorly plowed during winter, especially on mornings most cars go either to Pasvalys or Ažuolyne, i gave up on this spot after a hour and started to walk along the road
Not so much place to stop but cars go really slow
slow traffic(50km/h), huge place for cars to stop
Easily reachable, safe, got a ride to alytus in 20min!

easter monday, 10:30 AM waiting 20minutes to get a ride 60km in the direction of Alytus.
had a sign saying: Alytus Warszawa
Good place for Grodno, BY; Varena, LT.

Good spot, record is here, no longer that 2 min in few times :) You need to reach VADUVOS st. (trolleybus nr15 from main station) and then wait nr 51 bus. beware of time table, in that area 51 bus go 1 time in hour.
A really good place to go to Varėna, Alytus and other directions. Bus number 51 is going from the city, get out on the stop "Trakų Vokė".
Bad place, since everybody see you nobody want to take you. We walked 100 m behind this spot and caught car in five minutes, but it was lucky.
I tried to catch Riga, finally I changed the nameplate to panavezys and managed to get out smoothly
Great, spot. Tried to go to Riga with no success, changed the direction to Panevezys and got a ride in 5 minutes.

Great spot to Riga! We took 3g - 87 buses from the city and got off at the DEPO, from there its a short walk. Drivers can see the spot from the traffic light and can stop in the small bus stop. We only got a ride to Ukmergé but it was on a holiday with generally low traffic.
Nice spot if you want to go to Panevezys!
Within 5 minutes I got a ride to Poland to Augustow. It's not the best place, but there's no better in the area.

11.11.15 
We were left there by the previous driver. It wasn't the best place, but there were rather no other better. Very limited place to stay for the car, fast driving trucks. After 30 minutes one car stopped and took us to Warsaw.

Janurary 1st of 2015, very little trafic cause of new year. But with my girlfreind, we wait only 15 minutes for ride to SUWALKI.

We had a sign.

1 janvier 2015, très peu de trafic du fait du nouvel an. 

15 minutes d'attente avec ma copine.
Carton SUWALKI.
La ride nous a ammené jusqu'à SUWALKI.
A good option along this road I guess, but still shitty. No luck in the dusk for me!
A lot of local traffic. Make sense to get a lift for the next spot along A1. Sign doesn't help too much as a almost all the cars go short distance.
Most of the cars are already on the highway, try getting to the petrol station (circle k), from there you will get easily to Kaunas
Little traffic here. Go a bit further onto the acceleration lane. Much easier there.
altough you miss the traffic coming from north and from Klaipeda in this bus stop (only cars from the south come through here) it is still a quite good place towards Kaunas/Vilnius
It's the best HH place in Klaipeda to hh direction of Kaunas, Vilnius,ect. But there are no lights, so keep that in mind choosing to hh in the dark time.
Good spot for Kaunas. Only thing that you have to use public transport to get here (bus 20)
Tricky to get here as you have to walk up a hill but once you do there are many cars going towards Kaunas. I got lucky and a Polish truck driver took me to Poland!
it was a big surprise but a truck took me to Poland.

Pretty good HH place, but's it's a bit complicated to reach it. Look for public transport that goes to Zemieji paneriai.You can hh here or go after viaduc. It doesn't takes long to get a lift at least to Kaunas from here.

nobody took me to panevezys in 2 hours. if youre headed to Vilnius, dont make the same mistake as me just take the train to Panevezys, it costs 3€ for a student. hitchiking from Siauliai in this direction isnt worth it.
you need to take a bus 1 or 6
>PanevÄ—Å¾ys,Vilnius
You've got space to make cars stop 100m after the roundabout
HH place to hh direction of Palanga, Klaipeda

Waited veery long for a lift to siauliai, even though there was lots of traffic.. Maybe I wasn't lucky that day, but most cars signaled to me that they don't drive to siauliai but would take the next road to the west, so if you want to go there this spot maybe works better for you :)
It should be a really good spot, and maybe I wasn't lucky that day...but I waited more than 1h and finally got saved by a bus to the city.

Busstop on the west side of the A12 (Riga > Siauliai), going to Siauliai. There is also a busstop on the other side toward Riga

The opposite road leads to the famous Hill of Crosses (2 km).

Got picked up for a ride to Siauliai (10 km) after couple of minutes without a sign (but in mild rain).
To Kaunas, great spot despite the high speeds if you get dropped off here. I had to walk here from the nearest gas station which was not ideal but doable.

From August 2012 – My driver was heading to Vilnius and I was heading to Kaunas/Poland, so he was kind enough to drop me off here, after the split. There was a bus stop with space for cars, but trucks are going too fast to stop for you. This is the Via Baltica of course, the one main road connection Tallinn to Warsaw, so if you find a spot with space for cars to stop, you should eventually find your ride
To Kaunas, Germany. Even that cars are going too fast here - you are visible from distance, so drivers slow down a bit and see that there is enough space to stop their car and take you
After asking around for 30 minutes with sign Riga got a ride to Panevezys. There are a lot of truck drivers but it didn't help me to get a direct lift to Riga.

Get there by bus no. 57, after hour i get car to estonia. But we had a lot of chances to get to panevezys.
Just walk around gas station and ask them where they are going to.
almost no traffic but got a lift almost to Siauliai by one of the first cars that passed by
Got a lift to Kaunas in few minutes, gas station and a small shop right next to, free public camping place 1 km away

Did not waited long, 'was taken to Liepaja by Czech people
The spot actually is just after the cross
Hard to get a ride for Liepaja but found a ride to go to the border in 40min. Not the best place, but the airport in just nearby where there are shelters and cafe in case

Amazing gas station for either direction, try to find PL cars for going Poland and EST,LV for Latvia/Estonia, a lot of international cars around here, ask around, you'll most likely find someone going your way sooner or later, usually sooner, within 10-20 minutes. You can also hitchhike next to the gas station towards Panevežys if you find no cars going your way (north), still a very good bus stop also

Asked people at the gas station for a ride to Kaunas. Finally ended up thumbing at the exit of the station on the road to higher chances. Well in the end a guy coming from re-filling at the station took me to Kaunas and even drove me to (in his opinion) best service area on the way to Poland
Not very busy but every car passing you will most likely drive to Riga so that's nice. A long bus stop for cars to stop and they drive 60-80km/h. Good visibility.

Small bus stop towards Latvian border, little traffic and the bus stop does get local busses, whose driver was nice enough to get me a bit closer to the border, generally doable, main factor is just little traffic and quite some lithuanian cars still go to the nearby villages, wait times of 10-40 minutes expected

Better spot than the gas station on the roundabout. There is plenty of room for cars to stop. Most of the drivers were locals, traffic from the roundabout usually goes the other directions. Got a ride to Vilnius.

Duo, m/f
Sunday morning 
Fine spot for going west. Thumbed at the exit for 15 minutes, then we split and I decided to try with a sign next to the highway. Technically it's highway but theres an extra lane to pull over on, weird design but got us a ride straight to Warsaw (sign said warsaw)

The gravel road entrance after the traintracks is quite big, you'll get a car the least going to Skaudvile here, lots of lorries around here, the gravelside here is wide enough to stop them, low traffic, wait times of 10-40 minutes expected
Towards Skaudvile, good visibility, wide bus stop, low traffic, wait times of 10-30 minutes expected
Low traffic towards Jurbarkas-Skaudvile road, you can wait by the side of the small town or just walk on the road, wait times of 15-30 minutes expected

Towards Venta, decent enough traffic flow, straight road, no specific spot needed, the turns from Akmene seemed very uncomfortable for drivers to stop so I'd recommend you to just walk next to the road and thumb the cars, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Decent bus stop towards Akmene, Venta, fair enough traffic, the stop is a bit small, but the cars don't drive that fast there either, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Towards Naujoji Akmene, very low density of cars around here, you can hitch anywhere on the road, just straight good road, wait times of 20-40 minutes expected

Stopped here to hike up the dune. Nice guy at the ticket office who let me deposit his backpack behind the counter :) Towards Nida, Not really space to pull over for cars, still got taken by one of the first cars that passed
not that much traffic
enough space to stop and good visibility
bus stop, easy to stop and good visibility, cars rather fast
hitched from here as other were already hitching from the bus stop
lots of cars, not too much space to stop but doable to at least get a bit further
One of the better highway exits in Lithuania outside the big towns. Took a fairly short ride, would have waited for direct ride to kaunas hadnt it rained.
not that much traffic but a car will stop eventually

Direction north, if you got stuck around Akademija area and can't be bothered to take busses you can get way faster out around here, the side of the road is already wide and used for stopping cars, if you get a local car going somewhere in Kaunas, ask for Mega, it is very easy from Mega store to walk to a hitchhiking spots to out of Kaunas, give it a try, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Wide side for speeding lane, decent traffic, direction south towards Kruonis, lots of locals, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected
Towards Kruonis, Jieznas, Alytus, okay amount of traffic that all have slow speeds, but it's mainly locals, wait time of 5-60 minutes depending how choosing you are with your rides
A bit awkward spot for going southbound, small side of the road, but speeds are low due to roundabout so you'll get a car within 20 minutes, but beware, its mostly local traffic around here
Decent spot for heading south, got a ride within 15 minutes

Nice bus stop, during winters the roads are poorly maintained, so it's about only wider spot in the direction of Žagare, mainly locals and little traffic, oddly all the cars from Kemsiai turned to left so good to hunt them down as well, wait time of 10 minutes but not the best road for doing this
Towards Aleknos and LV, very little traffic, but there are latvian cars that pass by here, 1 car per 5-10 minutes,  wait time of 10 minutes, you can just walk all along the road if bored
Early afternoon, small traffic but ask a ride to the next gas station. Don't ask for long ride. It seems to be local
Because of the construction in the city center, there are not many cars going a long distance. But at least people were nice and we were quickly picked up.
Good spot to get a ride to panieviez. Huge traffic, no trucks. I got a ride while I was waiting for a bus , so if you don't get anything here, go farer to bus stop outside the city

My last ride let me out at this petrol station since he couldn't take me any further. So I don't know if it's easy to reach by foot, but I just asked drivers here and the first person took me directly to the hill of crosses :) so if you end up here I would just recommend asking the drivers, I don't think just standing there with a sign is effective..
If you start hitchhiking from joniskis I don't think this spot is ideal (there are probably others that make way more sense) but if you get out he
We were told to go further to the next bus stop. In the end, one nice guy picked us up right here and took us to Panevezy.
Good spot on direction to Via Baltica to get more to the north. Lot of space for cars as there is a bus stop.
Two guys with big backpacks, walked here from Kalvarija, noone stopped while walking, but here 10- and we got a ride to Alytus, friday around 13h.
I went with a sign at just after 07:00 (still dark). Cars moving very fast (speed limit 70 kph), but after about 30 min a kind truck driver stopped and took me directly to Riga.
Fast speeds but a lot of traffic. Good for Klaipeda but also north towards Latvia. Have a big sign. I had "LV" written and it took me on the right road but not too far.

first car stopped after 2 hours, but i think i just got very unlucky based on the other reviews. cars go very very fast and mostly ignore you. however the wait was worth it cause the first car that stopped took me to klaipeda.

very convenient spot to get to Klaipeda/Latvia. 
to conveniently get to the place take bus 32 until "9-ojo forto muziejus" bus stop from the city centre. costs 1 Euro but you can not pay if you're greedy, no one checks anyway.
We tried different signs, but only a few cars stopped. Most went to Klaipeda. Not the best spot to go to Latvia. Very much very fast traffic, but the spot itself is alright.
Good spot! I always waved to the incoming cars as well as those exiting the gas station. Took me one oil truck all the way to Riga. He was exiting the gas station.
Noone wanted to stop and take us with them, although we had very fast and pleasant hitches up to this spot. Not recommended from my side!
Good place with all the traffic going west. For silute, just take a car to the crossroad before pagegiai and go further on from there, no problem with that
Good HH place, but not much traffic to Silute. To Taurage or anywhere close mostly.
this spot is useless, people are looking at you weird and most cars are local. nobody stopped in over an hour. i moved to the gas station 1 km away.
Easy pickings here.  Just have a sign.
Bus stop with plenty of space to pull in.  Pretty much everywhere alone this road is a decent spot.
Better go north east. Not many cars.
Not a good place to Alytus/Vilnius. U should walk north-east until next crossroad. Its only about 1000-1300 meters.
Good spot directions Alytus / Vilnius and Augustow / Warszawa.

a bit of traffic. haven't tried to go deeper, maybe it's better as people suggest.
had a feeling that no one was going to kaunas/vilnius
to get out of Klaipeda and HH towards Kaunas or Vilnius, catch bus n.15 and get off at the last stop, then walk a bit to choose a good spot.(2009)
Didn't have any luck here heading towards Aukštadvaris, but seemed like a decent spot waited 60 minutes and then started walking all along the road
Cars don't go fast, no crazy traffic on a weekday late morning, but one of the best spots in Trakai to go in Marijampolė/Suwalki direction. There's enough place for cars to stop in.

good place from Vilnius towards Marijampole (get here with a bus from Vilnius bus station in 20', it also worths to spend an hour in Trakai)
bus stop, not fast cars, decent traffic
Great spot towards Klaipeda, good visibility, got a ride within 5 minutes

To Klaipeda, Palanga, Liepaja (LV). There is more then enough place for driver to stop, but the problem is a very high speed of cars. Only solution   is to be very very active, so drivers could notice you. I  was waiting here for the lift in the night only 15 min.
The other reviews must be from before the redesign of the roads here. Theres barely any traffic here and its fast. Very little space to stop due to guardrails everywhere. Avoid at all cost.
Not huge traffic, most cars are already on the highway, still found a ride as a duo after 5 minutes.

Better then the best HH place in Klaipeda!:) Even that it is forbiden to stop a car here (due to the   rules), everybody does it. My average time of waiting for the direct lift to Vilnius or Kaunas here not more then 6 min, I think.

Pretty poor spot for me, direction of Joniškis, most cars signaled turning away from the road, twice cars almost stopped but kept driving before finally got a ride after wait of 100 minutes, perhaps a18 junction would have been better, but it was snowy winter and roads were badly plowed all thorough the road

Quite good hitchability – cars should go here max 70 km/h in one line (in each direction). The extra lane for bus stop is long enough for cars to safely stop. 
Got a direct lift to Riga (it was my destination) after an hour. Solo guy.
First bus stop after intersection of E77, direction Jelgava and Riga. Good spot!
Although there is a lot of traffic, people are not really willing to stop. Got a ride after 35min to Palanga while holding an LV sign
Wanted to go to Liepaja, we found (2 persons) a ride to Palanga Airport in 30min. Quite good
Lot of traffics but cars go fast and they didn't care. Had to wait more than 1 hour with my sign vilnius on a sunday early afternoon
Best spot to go to the vilnus
Had a sign saying Vilnius and got a direct ride reasonably fast.
There is bus stop, but a lot of cars are going not only to Vilnius/Kaunas/Alytus, but also to the "Ratnycia" - part of Druskininkai.

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, rain. Going to Riga.
Good space. A bus stop with enough place for cars to stop. A bit on a curve, but good visibility.
After 15 minutes a couple took me to a border, where after not too long wait I got a ride to Riga.
It's pretty difficult to get out of there - especially in the morning hours
towards Latvia
We tried to catch something going north, for half a day, but didn't manage. Might be better for south though
Used this spot to get south, cause it seemed good and close to the city centre. Traffic on this on ramp can still go two directions, that's a bit shit. Good place for drivers to stop though.
Absolutely not safe, try to talk to the driver to drop you off somewhere safer. I had to walk around 2 kilometers and

Cars are going fast but there’s plenty of space to see you beforehand and space for cars and trucks to stop. This time I had a sign but the truck driver stopped and said he couldn’t read from that far, but he was going to Riga so that was nice!

cars are going too fast, literally no one stopped 
be advised --- getting away from this spot by foot is kinda tricky, because google maps is outdated and the forest in both sides is fenced off (it took me about 3hrs to walk to Babtai, got lost once & met 1 scary farm dog)
cars are going fast but you are visible form a distance and there is a large space for cars to stop
Can't stand by the road, not many cars stop here. Got lucky asking around but I'd avoid this spot
Hitched to Poland, but nobody stopped for 1 hour. Nobody stops here.
Direction to Poland
Not a best spot for stopping a car, but cars go relatively slow and they are ok to stop even if there is no place for this. If you are dropped here, do not worry - you will get a ride pretty fast.

Towards LV, very uncomfortable spot both for hitching and for cars to stop, just a small patch of gravel by the side of the road, speeds are decent, traffic density could be better but doable, wait times of 40-80 minutes to be expected
good spot just got unlucky little traffic
good spot not much traffic
After trying for 45 mins further on the Road we were lucky at the Traffic light and found someone who brought us to the Gasstation direction to kaunas
i dont reccomend this spot. almost no cars here and mostly locals going to Kelme. i hitched a ride to Siauliai in an hour fortunately.

24/7 kebab restaurant.
let me sleep, unprotected Wi-Fi.

No speeding up lane for south towards Jieznas so honestly better idea to walk a bit where you are on the straight part of the road, decent traffic, but might be a bit hard to catch a car, wait time of 10-40 minutes expected

Towards Telšiai, stood here after the speedbump, but maybe the speeds were too slow(?) since nobody picked me up within 40 or so minutes, so I started to walk down the road and about 400 meters later got picked up, lots of locals, but this is the short way from Mažeikiai to Telšiai

Direction of west, bit of an awkward spot, bus station on top of a hill, speeds are high, mostly locals on the roads south and north, gas station had only local cars. Got a car within 30 minutes, but I feel like I was a bit lucky

Main problem on this patch of road is that on direction north there's no streetlights so had to stay nearby this roundabout which was hard to get a car as two lanes soon go to 1 and lots of local traffic, took about 50 minutes to get a car, during daytime it'd be better
Gas station is mostly used by locals, but there's a small dirtroad with wide opening where cars can go, otherwise this part of the road is very difficult to get towards north
Towards north, small dirtroad where cars can pull, since there's turn on road speed's a bit slower, very little cars, locals, be aware a lot of them can turn towards Cedasai, wait time of 30 minutes
Decent spot, nice little forestroad where cars can pull to, little traffic tho, mostly locals, wait time of 20 minutes
The traffic light and the bus station help a bit, but the cars are still very fast.
Not a good spot to get to the north on Via Baltica,
Was here in August, very little traffic with barely any cross border traffic with no one stopping. I started walking towards Liepaja and got picked up while walking.

We were 3 guys hitchhiking toward Vilnius.
We waited around three hours there. Even got controled by the police. Maybe it was just unlucky plus the fact we where three because the spot semt good tho.
Not a lot of traffic, but you can get pretty long ride, probably worth to ask riders.
If you want to get through Kaunas more to the north, it's not a good spot as drivers ride to Kaunas, Vilnius or Klaipeda. Pretty low traffic in the evening and morning.

You have to put in the work yourself, meaning if you (for example) want to get to Kaunas, then go up to the truck drivers that have allready stopped and just ask them if they want to take you, otherwise kind of hard to pull the cars off the highway into the gas station to pick you up

Tough spot. Not a busy gas station but you can hitch the road from the gas station exit. Didn't have any luck to Latvia from here, only found a ride to the next village. If you wait long enough, getting to Riga shouldn't be a problem though.
We waited for two hours here and nobody took us anywhere, really bad spot.
Got a lift from the first guy we asked at the gas station. It was a polish guy going to Estonia on a Friday afternoon.
NEVER go there, it's almost impossible to get out of this place

Direction: Riga, Estonia

The road splits and it's usual to get dropped here. Left junction goes to Riga and right one to Birzai(Lithuanian town)
It is better to go on the crossroad with A6. There are some place to stop

The safest place to stay is on the ramp to the highway, but it is still not nice. There is only limited space to stop, and because the curve the cars don't see you very early. Also, there are not many cars, which makes it a bit safer, but we also had to wait for a long time.
Got car really quickly in Riga direction, but the spot Isa bit scatchy I think I was lucky.
